sub_topic: Preparation of 2-chloro-4-nitroaniline from aniline and chlorine gas
message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the preparation of 2-chloro-4-nitroaniline from aniline and chlorine gas? Show all the reactants, products, and their respective coefficients.
message_2:
The preparation of 2-chloro-4-nitroaniline from aniline and chlorine gas involves two main steps: nitration and chlorination. 

1. Nitration of aniline:
C6H7N + HNO3 -> C6H6N2O2 + H2O

In this step, aniline (C6H7N) reacts with nitric acid (HNO3) to form 4-nitroaniline (C6H6N2O2) and water (H2O).

2. Chlorination of 4-nitroaniline:
C6H6N2O2 + Cl2 -> C6H5ClN2O2 + HCl

In this step, 4-nitroaniline (C6H6N2O2) reacts with chlorine gas (Cl2) to form 2-chloro-4-nitroaniline (C6H5ClN2O2) and hydrogen chloride (HCl).

Overall balanced chemical equation:
C6H7N + HNO3 + Cl2 -> C6H5ClN2O2 + H2O + HCl
